subject: RE: [junit] Order of execution
msgSnippet: There is no guarantee that they will run in the order of the test file and you should not write your tests in a way that depends on this.  You should use the
messageBody:
There is no guarantee that they will run in the order of the test file and
you should not write your tests in a way that depends on this. You should
use the setUp and tearDown methods to properly setup each test.

Hope this helps.

Nathan

-----Original Message-----
From: Peter Kleczka [mailto:pkleczka@...]
Sent: Friday, November 29, 2002 1:43 PM
To: JUnit JUnit
Subject: [junit] Order of execution


Hello

I've read that textXXX() methods execute in
the order that they appear in the source file.
My tests seem to confirm this.

However, I've been told that tests run in
random order.

Can you clarify, or direct me to a source
where I can learn the answer.

TIA,
Pete (pkleczka@...)
